data.title: Soviet” cultural space
data.meta_description: The Russian invasion of Ukraine destroyed the single cultural space centered on Moscow that had existed until February 24. Through the prism of pop music Alexander Gorbachev tries to find the outlines of the new Russian culture.
data.text:
The original text in Russian was published in Holod.media and republished here with their permission.

What a sorrowful thing this, that today you’ll conceivably play

a promotional requiem and, without hackle or heart in the venture,

mention log roads made up of men’s flesh, half a vodka for pay,

laid so lavishly over your watery bog of a culture.

Viktor Krivulin. «Daughter of Kolyma» (translated by Thomas J. Kitson)
